intro: Merendera bulbocodioides, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces a bulbous root system that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a valuable addition to xeriscaped landscapes.
